revision.comment: removed [[Category:2010s independent films]]; added [[Category:2012 independent films]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox film | name = The Owner | image = | image_size = | border = | alt = | caption = | director = Xavier Agudo, Stanislava Buevich, Mike Canzoniero, Francois Coetzee, Martin de Barra, Todd Felderstein, Nicolas Fogliarini, Yango Gonzales, Omer Kula, Nino Leitner, Craig Lines, Vishesh Mankal, Giacomo Mantovani, Varun Mathur, Steve Murphy, Arne Nostitz-Rieneck, Asmit Pathare, Neha Raheja Thakker, Adam Ruszkowski, Alexander Schoenauer, Sabine Sebaali, Prashant Sehgal, Fahad Saikh, Marty Shea, Brian Shephard, Nicole Sylvester, John Versical, Rafael Yoshida | producer = | writer = | screenplay = | story = | based on = <!-- {{based on|title of the original work|writer of the original work}} --> | narrator = | starring = | music = David Alonso Garzon | cinematography = | editing = | studio = | distributor = | released = {{Film date|2012|05|25|United States}}<ref name=usatoday>{{cite news|last=Hinds|first=Julie|title='The Owner' sets Guinness record for most directors|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/movies/2013/01/17/owner-movie-guinness-record/1566418/|accessdate=24 March 2013|newspaper=USA Today|date=17 January 2013}}</ref> | runtime = | country = | language = English | budget = | gross = }} '''''The Owner''''' is a multi-director, international feature film that follows a backpack around the world, on its way back to its owner. It is the first film produced by [[CollabFeature]], a group of independent [[filmmaker]]s from all over the world. Each filmmaker [[screenwriter|wrote]] and [[film director|directed]] his or her own short segment of the film in his or her own country. ''The Owner'' began shooting in spring of 2010. It premiered in theaters around the world on May 25, 2012.<ref name=freep.com>{{cite news|last=Hinds|first=Julie|title=Backpack stars in local film|url=http://www.freep.com/article/20101119/ENT01/11190325/Backpack-stars-in-local-film#ixzz16XPY7HC3|accessdate=24 March 2013|newspaper=Detroit Free Press|date=19 November 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.collabfeature.com |title=The Collabfeature Group | International Feature Film Group |publisher=Collabfeature.com |date=2012-01-20 |accessdate=2012-02-16}}</ref> CollabFeature was started by Detroit-based filmmaker [[Marty Shea]] and web programmer [[Ian Bonner]].<ref name=Dubai>{{cite news|last=Al Hassani|first=Zaineb|title=Dubai filmmaker in international collaboration|url=http://www.thenational.ae/arts-culture/film/dubai-filmmaker-in-international-collaboration?pageCount=2|accessdate=24 March 2013|newspaper=The National|date=10 October 2010}}</ref>
==Plot== ''The Owner'' follows a lost [[backpack]] on a journey around the world, meeting several fascinating characters along the way. As the story progresses, we learn details about the mysterious man to whom the bag belongs—a man named "[[MacGuffin]]." The film brings together a variety of cultures, languages and [[film styles]] into a singular narrative [[narrative|plot]].
The feature consists of 25 independently produced short segments (2 to 5 minutes) that are connected by the backpack's journey. Each segment picks up the narrative where the previous segment leaves off and in some cases are inter-cut.<ref name="ReferenceA">1</ref>
Having 25 directors from 13 countries,<ref>{{Cite book|title=Guinness Book of Records|last=Glenday|first=Craig|publisher=|year=2013|isbn=978-1-908843-15-9|location=|pages=[https://archive.org/details/guinnessworldrec0000unse_r3e7/page/203 203]|quote=|via=|url=https://archive.org/details/guinnessworldrec0000unse_r3e7/page/203}}</ref> ''The Owner'' holds the [[Guinness World Record]] for "Most Directors of a Film."<ref name="ReferenceA"/> The world record claim was approved by Guinness on January 9, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Most directors of a film|url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/4000/most-directors-of-a-film|work=Guinness World Records|accessdate=24 March 2013}}</ref> Previously, ''[[Paris, je t'aime]]'' held the record with 21 directors.<ref name="freep.com"/><ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=rbZMg7CGnKYC&pg=PA316&lpg=PA316&dq=paris+je+t'aime+guinness#v=onepage&q&f=false |title=Guinness World Records 2008 - Craig Glenday - Google Books |publisher=Books.google.com |date= 2008-04-29|accessdate=2012-02-16|isbn=9780553589955 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/One-movie-25-directors/Article1-619830.aspx |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120918013647/http://www.hindustantimes.com/One-movie-25-directors/Article1-619830.aspx |url-status=dead |archive-date=2012-09-18 |title=One movie, 25 directors |publisher=Hindustan Times |date=2010-10-31 |accessdate=2012-02-16 }}</ref>
==Filmmakers== * [[Marty Shea]] - [[Detroit]], [[United States|USA]] * [[Rafael Yoshida]] - [[São Paulo]] * [[Fahad Shaikh]] - [[Dubai]] * [[Sabine Sebaali]] - [[Beirut]] * Steve Murphy - [[London]] * [[Varun Mathur]] - [[New Delhi]] * [[Brian Shephard]] - [[Orlando, Florida|Orlando, FL]] * [[Asmit Pathare]] - [[Mumbai]] * [[Nicolas Fogliarini]] - [[Paris]] * [[Neha Raheja Thakker]] - [[Mumbai]] * [[Vishesh Mankal]] - [[New Delhi]] * [[Francois Coetzee]] - [[Cape Town]] * [[Mairtin de Barra]] - [[Dublin]] * [[Xavier Agudo]] - [[Berlin]] * [[Yango González]] - [[Bogota]], [[Colombia]] * [[Alexander Schoenauer]] - [[Berlin]] * [[Nino Leitner]] - [[Innsbruck]], [[Austria]] * [[Arne von Nostitz-Rieneck]] - [[Vienna]] * [[Reenita Malhotra]] - [[Hong Kong]] * [[Michael Canzoniero]] - [[New York City]] * [[Nicole Sylvester]] - [[Brooklyn]] * [[Todd Felderstein]] - [[Los Angeles]], [[United States|USA]] * [[Prashant Sehgal]] - [[New Delhi]] * [[John Versical]] - [[Chicago]] * [[Craig Lines]] - [[Newcastle upon Tyne|Newcastle, England]] <ref name="ReferenceA"/>
